item.title: Understanding firewalld zone
item.description: Topology: subnet100: 192.168.100.0/24 web01: 192.168.100.111 web02: 192.168.100.112 subnet200: 192.168.200.0/24 In firewalld, there is a trusted zone: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <zone target="ACCEPT"> <short>Trusted</short> <description>Trusted</description> <service name="ssh"/> <source address="192.168.100.0/24"/> <forward/> </zone> I initially expected that only ssh would be open to subnet100.

item.title: Summary of Setting up Firewall on Different Distros
item.description: In this article, I will cover the basics of setting up firewalls on different distros, including firewalld, ufw, and iptables. We will also discuss the daily tasks of firewall management, such as allowing or blocking specific source addresses/destination ports, port forwarding, and NAT.
